definition: li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
(bird species of China) Pander's ground jay (Podoces panderi)

sentences.english: The Volga River and the Ural River discharge into the Caspian Sea.
sentences.chinese: 伏尔加河以及乌拉尔河都有流入里海。

sentences.english: Potentially huge oil fields also lie underneath the Caspian Sea.
sentences.chinese: 在里海的底部存在了巨大的石油能源。

sentences.english: But this year, fewer fish are coming into the Volga delta from the Caspian Sea to spawn.
sentences.chinese: 但今年，从里海来伏尔加河产卵的鱼群数量减少了。

sentences.english: Multiple rivers empty into the Caspian Sea, the Volga being the largest.
sentences.chinese: 有多支河流注入里海，其中最大的一条是伏尔加河。

sentences.english: Measured by surface area, the Caspian Sea is the world’s largest inland water body.
sentences.chinese: 从水面面积上讲，里海是世界上最大的内陆水体。

sentences.english: However the Caspian Sea oil source it was to transport didn't pan out that well.
sentences.chinese: 不过里海的石油资源也运的不怎么好就是了。

sentences.english: Kara-Bogaz-Gol is a saline inlet along the lake’s eastern perimeter.
sentences.chinese: 卡拉博加兹戈尔湾在里海东岸，是一个盐湖。

sentences.english: The Caspian holds a great amount of sturgeon, which yield eggs that are processed into caviar.
sentences.chinese: 里海生产大量的鲟鱼，这些鲟鱼可以加工成鱼子酱。

sentences.english: US will probably get rights to the oil pipeline from the Caspian sea though. The Great Game begins anew.
sentences.chinese: 不过，美国将有可能从里海的输油管道上获得好处。

sentences.english: The only two revealed right now are Caspian Border and o Operation Métro.
sentences.chinese: 仅有的两个发现，现在是里海边境和O操作新城。

sentences.english: Do you remember the beauty of the caspian sea esmail?
sentences.chinese: 你还记得里海的美景吗，埃斯莫尔？

sentences.english: Round the north-east of the Black and Caspian Seas were coming the Medes and Persians.
sentences.chinese: 从黑海和里海的东北部来了米堤亚人和波斯人。
里海的梭鲈，哈萨克斯坦，1999。

definition: Amu Darya, the biggest river of Central Asia, from Pamir to Aral sea, forming the boundary between Afghanistan and Tajikistan then flowing through Turkmenistan and Uzbekistan/formerly called Oxus by Greek and Western writers, and Gihon by medieval Islamic writers
Sea of Azov in southern Russia
Syr Darya, Central Asian river, flowing from Kyrgiz Republic through Kazakhstan to the Aral sea
